intro: Onosma lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and spikes of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, arid climates. Onosma lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
